text.section: The Board may approve Medbank of Maryland, Inc., or another licensed pharmacy, to be a repository.

A repository shall dispense donated prescription drugs and medical supplies only:
To an individual who meets the requirements of § 15-606 of this subtitle;
On a new prescription, in the case of a prescription drug or medical supply that requires a prescription; and
In accordance with State and federal laws pertaining to:
Storage, distribution, and dispensing of prescription drugs; and
Confidentiality of patient information.

A repository may:
Charge a fee, not to exceed $10, for each prescription drug or medical supply dispensed; and
Dispense a donated prescription drug or medical supply by mail, provided that the repository informs the patient that a delay may be entailed.
A repository may not establish or maintain a waiting list for any prescription drug or medical supply dispensed by the Program.
A pharmacy may accept prescription drugs and medical supplies taken to the pharmacy for disposal only if the pharmacy is approved by the Board as a repository for this purpose.
The Program may not require a private entity to establish, operate, or fund a drop-off site or disposal program.
